Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: ABANDONMENT DATE: Date the well was plugged and permanently abandoned.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.4: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.5: ASSIGNED FIELD: The field that this well is assigned to for production purposes.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH: the deepest, bottom or base measured depth in which this wellcomponent is found.
Column Comment.7: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE for the base depth.
Column Comment.8: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)on the wellbore.
Column Comment.9: BASE STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET ID: Name set from which the base stratigraphicunit is derived.
Column Comment.10: BASE STRAT UNIT ID: The stratigraphic unit (formation) identified as the base of theinterval for a well component.
Column Comment.11: BOTTOM HOLE LATITUDE: Latitude of bottom hole point projected to surface. Forstraight wells this would be exactly the same as surface latitude or null (denormalizedform well_node).
Column Comment.12: BOTTOM HOLE LONGITUDE: Longitude of bottom hole point projected to surface.For straight wells this would be exactly the same as surface longitude or null(denormalized form well_node).
Column Comment.13: CASING FLANGE ELEVATION: Elevation of the casing flange measured from sealevel.
Column Comment.14: CASING FLANGE ELEVATION OUOM: Casing flange elevation original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.15: COMPLETION DATE: Date on the official filing or completion report indicating thewell is established as ready to produce, inject or abandon.
Column Comment.16: CONFIDENTIAL DATE: Date confidential information can be released to the generalpublic.
Column Comment.17: CONFIDENTIAL DEPTH: Depth where a confidential formation begins.
Column Comment.18: CONFIDENTIAL DEPTH OUOM: Confidentiality depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: CONFEDENTIALITY TYPE: Describes the types of confidentiality types usuallyassociated with a well. For example confidential, non-confidential or confidential 90days.
Column Comment.20: CONFIDENTIAL STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thestratigraphic name set. A stratigraphic name set is an unordered collection ofstratigraphic units, that may be in use for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, acompany etc.
Column Comment.21: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.22: WELL CLASS: REFERENCE WELL CLASSIFICATION: Identifies the classification ofa well commonly based on the Lahee system. For example New Field Wildcat,Deeper Pool Test, Outpost or Development.
Column Comment.23: CURRENT STATUS: The present status, denormalized from the status table. Useonly if needed.
Column Comment.24: CURRENT STATUS DATE: Date of the current status of the well.
Column Comment.25: WELL DEEPEST DEPTH: The deepest depth drilled occurs for remedial operationsin which the new remedial depth is less than the original measured depth. Thedeepest depth captures the original measured depth before the remedial drillingevent. The depth at time of completion is the remedial drilled depth. Deepest depthdrilled allows the database to store any depths greater than the completed remedialdepth.
Column Comment.26: DEEPEST DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.27: DEPTH DATUM: The point from which all depths are measured. For example: kellybushing, ground level, barge floor
Column Comment.28: DEPTH DATUM ELEVATION: Operator reported elevation of the measurementdatum used as a reference for other measured well points.
Column Comment.29: DEPTH DATUM ELEVATION OUOM: Depth Datum Elevation original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.30: DERRICK FLOOR ELEVATION: Elevations that are reported from the Derrick floor.
Column Comment.31: DERRICK FLOOR ELEVATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.32: DIFFERENCE LOWEST ASTRONOMICAL TIDE MINUS MEAN SEA LEVEL: thecomputed difference between LAT and MSL.
Column Comment.33: DISCOVERY INDICATOR: Y(es) or N(o) indicating the well is a discovery, a new,untapped oil/gas reservoir that has the potential to be economically feasible.
Column Comment.34: DRILLERS TOTAL DEPTH: Total or maximum depth of the well as reported by theoperator/ driller.
Column Comment.35: DRILLERS TOTAL DEPTH OUOM: Driller total depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.37: ELEVATION REFERENCE DATUM: the name of the datum to which elevations arereferenced e.g. MSL or LAT.
Column Comment.38: ENVIRONMENT: the type of environment that the well is in, such as land, marine,transition zone etc.
Column Comment.39: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.40: FAULTED INDICATOR: Y(es) or N(o) indicating a well has been faulted.
Column Comment.41: FINAL DRILL DATE: Date the drilling operations for the well were finalized.
Column Comment.42: FINAL TOTAL DEPTH: The actual measurement along the well path from thereference datum to the bottom of the well.
Column Comment.43: FINAL TOTAL DEPTH OUOM: Final total depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.44: GROUND ELEVEVATION: The elevation of the ground at the well site.
Column Comment.45: GROUND ELEVATION OUOM: Ground elevation original unit of measure.
Column Comment.46: GROUND ELEVATION TYPE: The type of point or horizontal surface used as anelevation reference for measurements in a well. For example: kelly bushing, ground,sea level.
Column Comment.47: WELL CLASS: REFERENCE WELL CLASSIFICATION: Identifies the classification ofa well commonly based on the Lahee system. For example New Field Wildcat,Deeper Pool Test, Outpost or Development
Column Comment.48: KELLY BUSHING ELEVATION: The elevation of the kelly bushing (generallymeasured from sea level)
Column Comment.49: KELLY BUSHING ELEVATION OUOM: Kelly Bushing elevation original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.50: LEASE NAME: Name assigned to the lease by the regulatory agency with jurisdictionover the minerals in the area where the lease is located.
Column Comment.51: LEASE NUMBER: Number assigned to the lease by the regulatory agency withjurisdiction over the minerals in the area where the lease is located.
Column Comment.52: LEGAL SURVEY TYPE: The survey type used for legal descriptions. For example,Carter, Congressional, Dominion Land Survey, ...
Column Comment.53: LOCATION TYPE: Identifies the type of object being given a legal location. Forexample, node, well, ...
Column Comment.54: LOGGERS TOTAL DEPTH: Total or maximum depth of the well as measured by thelogging tool and reported by the logger/logging service.
Column Comment.55: LOGGERS TOTAL DEPTH OUOM: Logger total depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.56: MAXIMUM TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The maximum true vertical depth from thesurface datum reference to the final total depth or deepest point, measured on astraight line.
Column Comment.57: MAXIMUM TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: Maximum true vertical depth originalunit of measure.
Column Comment.58: NET PAY: The cumulative reservoir rock capable of producing within the entirethickness of a pay zone. The net pay within a gross interval.
Column Comment.59: NETPAY OUOM: Net pay original unit of measure.
Column Comment.60: OLDEST STRATIGRAPHIC AGE: the name of the geologic age, such as Triassic,Jurassic, Quaternary Pleistocene, Tertiary Pliocene. The value will not be absolutegeologic age in millions of years (125,000 mya).
Column Comment.61: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.62: OLDEST STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphicname set. A stratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units,that may be in use for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.63: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.64: OPERATOR: The Business Associate representing the owners of the well,responsible for the operations of drilling and producing the well and for reportingthese activities to the partners and regulatory agencies.
Column Comment.65: PLATFORM IDENTIFIER: Unique number assigned to the offshore drilling platformor onshore drilling pad..
Column Comment.66: PLATFORM SF SUBTYPE: Part of the FK from SF PLATFORM.
Column Comment.67: PLOT NAME: Well name alias used when plotting the well on a map.
Column Comment.68: PLOT SYMBOL: A character or symbol used to represent well status. This may be aparticular mapping package coding scheme, or a pointer to other applicationdependent files.
Column Comment.69: PLUGBACK DEPTH: Depth of the point that the well was plugged back to whensetting the casing or completing the well.
Column Comment.70: PLUGBACK DEPTH OUOM: Plugback depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.71: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.72: PRIMARY SOURCE: The primary source that was used to construct this well data.
Column Comment.73: WELLBORE SHAPE: A reference table describing a type of wellbore shape. Forexample vertical, horizontal, directional or s-shaped.
Column Comment.74: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.75: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.76: RIG ON SITE DATE: The date that the drilling rig is moved onto the well site.
Column Comment.77: RIG RELEASE DATE: Date the drilling rig can be released from operations andmoved from the well site as specified in the contract.
Column Comment.78: ROTARY TABLE ELEV: The elevation of the rotary table. This is needed to trackAustralian information.
Column Comment.80: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or journals.
Column Comment.81: SPUD DATE: Date the drilling operations commenced on the well. The first day holeis made.
Column Comment.82: STATUS TYPE: The type of status reported for the well. Can include constructionstatus, operating status, producing status, abandonment status etc.
Column Comment.83: SUBSEA REFERENCE ELEVATION TYPE: The reported type of elevation that wasused to determine the subsea elevation, such as Kelly Bushing, Driller Floor, CasingFlange, Rotary Table etc. The Subsea elevation is computed by subtracting theground elevation from the elevation reported by the drilling contractor.
Column Comment.84: SURFACE LATITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, north or south of theequator. A positive value represents a north latitude. (denormalized from the wellnode table)
Column Comment.85: SURFACE LONGITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, east or west of theprime meridian of the geodetic datum. A negative value represents a west longitude.(denormalized from the well node table)
Column Comment.86: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)on the wellbore.
Column Comment.87: TAX CREDIT CODE: Code indicating the well qualifies for a tax credit. "C" = credit forthe well being permitted for coalbed methane gas.
Column Comment.88: TOTAL DEPTH STRATIGRAPHIC AGE: the name of the geologic age, such asTriassic, Jurassic, Quaternary Pleistocene, Tertiary Pliocene. The value will not beabsolute geologic age in millions of years (125,000 mya) .
Column Comment.89: TOTAL DEPTH STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the AGEBASED stratigraphic name set. A stratigraphic name set is an unordered collection ofstratigraphic units, that may be in use for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, acompany etc.
Column Comment.90: TOTAL DEPTH STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thestratigraphic name set. A stratigraphic name set is an unordered collection ofstratigraphic units, that may be in use for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, acompany etc.
Column Comment.91: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.92: TOP DEPTH: the shallowest or top measured depth in which this well component isfound.
Column Comment.93: TOP DEPTH ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.94: TOP STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET ID: Name set from which the top stratigraphicunit is derived.
Column Comment.95: TOP STRAT UNIT ID: The stratigraphic unit (formation) identified as the top of theinterval for a well component.
Column Comment.96: WATER ACOUSTIC VELOCITY: the average acoustic velocity from surface to seabed near the well site.
Column Comment.98: WATER DEPTH: Depth of the water at a well (measured from the water level to themud line).
Column Comment.99: WATER DATUM: Reference datum to which the water depth is referenced, such asmean sea level.
Column Comment.100: WATER DEPTH OUOM: Water depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.101: WELL EVENT NUMBER: Allows well events such as re-entries to be trackedseparately, rather than embedded as a component in the UWI.
Column Comment.102: WELL GOVERNMENT IDENTIFIER: Number assigned by a regulatory agency orgovernment to identify a well. For example API or CPA number.
Column Comment.103: WELL INTERSECT MEASURED DEPTH: The measured depth of the point ofintersection of the parent well and this well. Also referred to as kick-off point.
Column Comment.104: WELL LEVEL TYPE: Indicates which well component this row describes, as outlinedin www.WhatIsAWell.org. Values may include WELL, WELL ORIGIN, WELLBORE,WELLBORE SEGMENT, WELLBORE COMPLETION or WELLBORE CONTACTINTERVAL. UNKNOWN may be used if the type of component is not known. WellSets should be loaded into WELL_SET. WELLHEAD STREAM is mapped intoFACILITY.
Column Comment.105: WELL NAME: Name assigned to the well. This may be the legal or registered nameas it appears on a permit or a given name assigned by the operator.
Column Comment.106: WELL NUMBER: Number or alphanumeric name assigned to each well by theoperator. For example J21 or 10-26.
Column Comment.107: WHIPSTOCK DEPTH: Measurement of the depth position of the whipstock. This isused for side tracking or directional drilling.
Column Comment.108: WHIPSTOCK DEPTH OUOM: Whipstock depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.109: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.110: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.111: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.112: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.113: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.114: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.115: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
